forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 54, with temperatures falling to around 51 in the afternoon. West wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 42. Northwest wind around 7 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco this afternoon, the sky presents a canvas of clarity, kissing the edge of winter with a crisp, inviting quality. As the sun retreats from its zenith, the temperature whispers promises of coolness, dipping to a comfortable fifty-one degrees. A gentle westerly breeze rustles through the streets, providing just enough movement to keep one awake and engaged. You may notice the absence of fog, as the bay remains clearly outlined, with the distant hills framing the horizon, devoid of the usual tricks of marine layers.

The evening beckons with its partly cloudy demeanor, perfect for a stroll through the neighborhood or perhaps a visit to a cozy café, where the warmth and aroma of freshly brewed coffee can make the chill more bearable. As twilight draws near, temperatures will slide down to a serene forty-two, so wearing layers—perhaps a light sweater over a long-sleeved shirt—will be wise. The charm of the city at dusk invites a simple pleasure, whether you choose to wander along Embarcadero or simply lean into the silence with a good book, allowing the vibrance of the city itself to become the backdrop of a restful evening.
